data.title: Joachim Raff: Catalogue
data.text:
Catalogue - Orchestral Music

Symphonies

Symphony in E minor WoO.18 (1850-55).

Unpublished. LOST. Premiere: 20 April 1855, Weimar. III. & IV. were re-used as V. & IV. in the Orchestral Suite No.1 Op.101 (see below).

I. Allegro appassionato.

II. Andante.

III. Marsch [March]. Deciso.

IV. Scherzo (Presto).

V. Fuge [Fugue].

Symphony No.1 in D major An das Vaterland [To the Fatherland] Op.96 (1859-61). Listen to an extract

Published: Schuberth, 1864. Premiere: 22 February 1863, Vienna. Won 1st Prize in the Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde competition in Vienna in 1862.

I. Allegro.

II. Scherzo (Allegro molto vivace, quasi presto).

III. LarghettoAndanteLarghetto.

IV. Allegro drammatico.

V. Larghetto, sostenutoAllegro deciso, trionfante.

Symphony No.2 in C major Op.140 (1866). Listen to an extract

Published: 1869, Schott. Premiere: 1 March 1867, Wiesbaden.

I. Allegro.

II. Andante con moto.

III. Allegro vivace.

IV. Andante maestosoAllegro con spirito.

Symphony No.3 in F major Im Walde [In the Forest] Op.153 (1869). Listen to an extract

Published: 1871, Kistner. Premiere: 17 April 1870, Weimar.

Part 1 - Am Tage. Eindrücke und Empfindungen [Daytime. Impressions & Feelings]. I. Allegro.

Part 2  In der Dämmerung [In the Twilight]:

A. Träumerie [Reverie]: II. Largo.

B. Tanz der Dryaden [Dance of the Dryads]: III. Allegro assai.

Part 3  Nachts. Stilles Weben der Nacht im Walde. Einzug und Auszug der Wilden Jagd mit Frau Holle (Hulda) und Wotan. Anbruch des Tages [At Night. Night Weaves Silently Through the Forest. Arrival and Departure of the Wild Hunt, with Frau Holle (Hulda) and Wotan. Daybreak]: IV. Allegro.

Symphony No.4 in G minor Op.167 (1871). Listen to an extract

Published: 1872, Schuberth. Premiere: 8 February 1872, Wiesbaden.

I. Allegro.

II. Allegro molto.

III. Andante, non troppo mosso.

IV. Allegro.

Symphony No.5 in E major Lenore Op.177 (1872). Listen to an extract

Published: 1873, Seitz. Premiere: 13 December 1872, Sondershausen.

Part 1  Liebesglück [Loves Happiness]: I. Allegro. II. Andante quasi Larghetto.

Part 2  Trennung [Separation]: Marsch [March].

Part 3  Wiedervereinigung im Tode. Introduktion und Ballade (nach Bürgers Lenore) [Reunited in Death. Introduction and Ballade (after Bürgers Lenore)]: IV. Allegro.

Symphony No.6 in D minor Op.189 (1873). Listen to an extract

Published: 1874, Bote & Bock. Premiere: 21 October 1874, Berlin. Motto: Gelebt: Gestrebt, Gelitten, GestrittenGestorbenUmworben [Lived: struggled, suffered, foughtDiedGlorified].

I. Allegro non troppo.

II. Vivace.

III. Larghetto, quasi Marcia funebre.

IV. Allegro con spirito.

Symphony No.7 in B flat major In den Alpen [In the Alps] Op.201 (1875).

Listen to an extract

Published: 1876, Seitz. Premiere: 30 December 1875, Wiesbaden.

I. Wanderung im Hochgebirg [A Walk in the Mountains]: AndanteAllegro.

II. In der Herberge [At the Inn]: Andante quasi Allegro.

III. Am See [By the Lake]: Larghetto.

IV. Beim Schwingfest: Abschied [At the Wrestling Contest; Farewell]: Allegro.

Symphony No.8 in A major Frühlingsklänge [Spring Sounds] Op.205 (1876).

Listen to an extract

Published: 1877, Siegel. Premiere: 15 March 1877, Wiesbaden.

I. Frühlings Rückkehr [Springs Return]: Allegro.

II. In der Walpurgisnacht [During Walpurgisnight]: Allegro.

III. Mit dem ersten Blumenstrauß [With the First Bouquet of Flowers]: Larghetto.

IV. Wanderlust: Vivace.

Symphony No.9 in E minor Im Sommer [In Summer] Op.208 (1878). Listen to an extract

Published: 1879, Siegel. Premiere: 2 March 1879, Wiesbaden.

Part 1 - Ein heißer Tag [A Hot Day]: I. Allegro.

Part 2 - Die Jagd der Elfen. Versammlung der Elfen; Oberon und Titania; die Jagd; Rückkehr der Elfen mit Oberon und Titania [The Hunt of the Elves. Gathering of the Elves; Oberon and Titania; the Hunt; Return of the Elves with Oberon and Titania]: II. Allegro.

Part 3 - A. Ekloge [Eclogue]: III. Larghetto.

Part 3 - B. Zum Erntekranz [The Harvest Wreath]: IV. Allegro.

Symphony No.10 in F minor Zur Herbstzeit [To Autumn] Op.213 (1879-80). Listen to an extract

Published: 1882, Siegel (posthumous). Premiere (original version): 12 November 1880, Wiesbaden; (revised version: 18 November 1881, Wiesbaden). After the première, the original 3rd movement was replaced by a new one. For the original movement, see Elegie WoO.48 (see below).

I. Eindrücke und Empfindungen [Impressions and Feelings]: Allegro moderato.

II. Gespenster-Reigen [Ghostly Round-Dance]: Allegro.

III. Elegie [Elegy]: Adagio.

IV. Die Jagd der Menschen. (AuszugRastJagdHallaliRückkehr) [Men Hunting. (DepartureRestHuntIn at the KillReturn)]: Allegro.

Symphony No.11 in A minor Der Winter [Winter] Op.214 (1876). Listen to an extract

Published: 1883, Siegel (posthumous, revised and edited by Max Erdmannsdörfer). Premiere: 21 February 1883, Wiesbaden. Composed immediately before Symphony No.8 (see above), the reason the work was set aside is not known.

I. Der erste Schnee [The First Snow]: Allegro.

II. Allegretto.

III. Am Kamin [By the Stove]: Larghetto.

IV. Karneval [Carnival]: Allegro.

Concertos

La Fée damour [The Love Fairy] Op.67 (1855). Listen to an extract

Concert Piece for violin & orchestra. Published 1877/78, Schott. Premiere: 20 April 1855, Weimar.

Ode au Printemps [Ode to Spring] Op.76 (1857). Listen to an extract

Concert Piece for piano & orchestra. Published: 1862, Schott. Premiere: 6 February 1860, Mainz.

Violin Concerto No.1 in B minor Op.161 (1871). Listen to an extract

Published: 2007, 1871, Siegel (probably only for rental). 2007, Edition Nordstern. Premiere: 24 August 1871, Wiesbaden.

I. Allegro pateticoII. Andante non troppoIII. Allegro trionfale

Suite for Solo Violin & Orchestra Op.180 (1873). Listen to an extract

Published: 1873, Siegel. Premiere: 9 December 1873, Bad Homburg.

I. Preludio [Prelude]: Allegro.

II. Minuetto [Minuet]: Largamente.

III. Corrente: Allegro.

IV. Aria: Larghetto.

V. Il moto perpetuo. Finale (Allegro vivo).

Piano Concerto in C minor Op.185 (1873). Listen to an extract

Published: 1874, Siegel. Premiere: 30 July 1873, Wiesbaden.

I. Allegro.

II. Andante, quasi Larghetto.

III. Finale (Allegro).

Cello Concerto No.1 in D minor Op.193 (1874). Listen to an extract

Published: 1875, Siegel. Premiere: 4 November 1874, Dresden.

I. AllegroII. LarghettoIII. Finale (Vivace).

Suite for piano & orchestra in E flat major Op.200 (1875). Listen to an extract

Published: 1876, Siegel. Premiere: 22 December 1875, Bad Homburg.

I. Introduktion & Fuge [Introduction & Fugue]: Allegro.

II. Menuett [Minuet]: Allegro.

III. Gavotte & Musette: Allegro.

IV. Cavatine [Cavatina]: Larghetto.

V. Finale (Allegro).

Cello Concerto No.2 in G major WoO.44 (1876). Listen to an extract

Published: 1997, Edition Nordstern. Premiere: 27 May 1997, Lachen.

I. Allegro.

II. Andante.

III. Allegro vivace.

Violin Concerto No.2 in A minor Op.206 (1877). Listen to an extract

Published: 1878, Siegel. Premiere: 1 November 1877, Erfurt.

I. Allegro.

II. Adagio.

III. Allegro.

Orchestral Suites

Orchestral Suite No.1 in C major Op.101 (1863). Listen to an extract

Published: 1865, Schott. Premiere: 26 February 1864, Karlsruhe. IV. & V. were originally IV. & III. of the Symphony in E minor WoO.18 (see above).

I. Introduktion & Fuge [Introduction & Fugue]: Maestoso.

II. Menuett [Minuet]: Allegro molto.

III. Adagietto.

IV. Scherzo (Presto).

V. Marsch [March]: Deciso.

Italian Suite in E minor WoO.35 (1871). Listen to an extract

Published: 1884, Ries & Erler (posthumous). Premiere: 26 November 1883, Berlin. II. & IV. used as entr'actes in the opera Benedetto Marcello WoO.46.

I. Overture: Allegro molto.

II. Barcarole: Andantino.

III. Intermezzo (Pulchinella): Presto.

IV. Notturno [Nocturne]: Andante non troppo lento.

V. Tarantelle [Tarantella]: Molto vivace.

Orchestral Suite No.2 in F major In ungarischer Weise [In Hungarian Style] Op.194 (1874). Listen to an extract

Published: 1876, Bahn. Premiere: 5 March 1875, Wiesbaden.

I. An der Grenze [At the Border]. Overture: AdagioAllegro.

II. Auf der Puszta. Träumerei [On the Puszta. Reverie]: Larghetto.

III. Bei einem Aufzug der Honvéd. Marsch [Amongst a Parade of the Honvéd. March]: Quasi Marcia.

IV. Volkslied mit Variationen [Folksong with Variations]: AdagioVar. I-IX.

V. Vor der Czárda [At the Czárda]. Finale (Larghetto).

Aus Thüringen [From Thuringia], Suite in B flat major WoO.45 (1875). Listen to an extract

Published: 1893, Ries & Erler. Premiere: 27 March 1878, Sondershausen.

I. Salus Intrantibus [Good Health to Those Who Enter]: Allegro.

II. Elisabethenhymne [Hymn to Elisabeth]: Larghetto.

III. Reigen der Gnome & Sylphen [Round-Dance of the Gnomes and Sylphs]: Vivace.

IV. Variationen über das Volklied [Variations on the Folk Song]: LargoVar. 1-11Coda.

V. Ländliches Fest [Country Festival]: Allegro, quasi Marcia giojosa.

Other Orchestral Works

Festmarsch zur Säcularfeier von Goethes Geburtstag [Festival March for the Secular Celebration of Goethes Birthday] WoO.8A by Franz Liszt (1849).

Unpublished. Premiere: 7 March 1850, Weimar. Orchestration, made at Liszt's suggestion, of his March S.227 for piano.

Fest-ouvertüre [Festival Overture] WoO.15 (1851-53).

Unpublished. LOST. Premiere: 20 May 1853.

Musik zum geschichtlichen Trauerspiel Bernhard von Weimar [Music to the Historical Tragedy Bernhard von Weimar] WoO.17 (1854). Listen to an extract

Published: II. & VI. published 1885, Aibl (posthumous); other nos. unpublished. Premiere: 2 January 1855, Weimar. Incidental music for the play Bernhard von Weimar by Wilhelm Genast. Overture rewritten and published as Ein feste Burg ist unser Gott Op.127 (see below).

I. Overture.

II. March (before Act 3).

III. Five fanfares and battle music for Act 3.

IV. March in Act 3.

V. Fanfare & March at end of Act 3.

VI. Untitled music before Act 4.

VII. Marschmusik [March music] for Act 5.

VIII. Untitled music for the end of Act 5.

Appendix I, alternative to No.VIII.

Appendix II, additional short piece between III. & IV.

Jubelouvertüre [Celebration Overture] Op.103 (1864). Listen to an extract

Published: 1865, Kahnt. Premiere: 24 August 1864, Wiesbaden.

Fest-ouvertüre [Festival Overture] Op.117 (1864). Listen to an extract

Published: 1865, Kistner. Premiere: 14 December 1865, Leipzig.

Concert Overture Op.123 (1862). Listen to an extract

Published: 1866, Siegel. Premiere: 25 April 1863.

Ein feste Burg ist unser Gott [A Mighty Fortress is our God] Op.127 (1854-65).

Listen to an extract

Published: 1866, Hofmeister. Premiere: original reworked version - 10 March 1856, Jena; final version - 25 March 1866, Karlsruhe. Reworking of the Overture to Bernhard von Weimar WoO.17 (see above), revised several times before publication.

Festmarsch [Festival March] Op.139 (1867). Listen to an extract

Published: 1877, Schott. Premiere: 8 October 1867, Weimar.

Huldigungs-Marsch [Homage March] WoO.34A by Wagner (1871).

Listen to an extract

Published: 1871, Schott. Premiere: November 1871, Vienna. Orchestration made at the request of Wagner and the publisher.

J.S. Bachs Chaconne in D minor for solo Violin arranged for orchestra WoO.39 (1873). Listen to an extract

Published: 1874, Seitz. Premiere: 28 March 1874, Wiesbaden. Orchestration of Bach's Chaconne BWV.1004, No.5

Abends: Rhapsodie [Evening: Rhapsody] Op.163b (1874). Listen to an extract

Published: 1874, Ries & Erler. Premiere: 23 October 1874, Wiesbaden. Arrangement of fifth movement of Piano Suite Op.163.

J.S. Bach's English Piano Suite (in G minor) arranged for orchestra WoO.41 (1874). Listen to an extract

Published: 1892, Ries & Erler (posthumous) without final movement, which is lost. Premiere: 1 January 1905, Wiesbaden. Orchestration of Bach's Keyboard Suite BWV.808.

I. Prelude: Allegro.

II. Allemande: Allegro moderato.

III. Courant: Allegro Vivace.

IV. Sarabande: Andante sostenuto.

V. Gavotte: Molto Allegro.

VI. Gigue.

Elegie [Elegy] WoO.48 (1879). Listen to an extract

Published: 2003, Edition Nordstern. Premiere: 12 November 1880, Wiesbaden as the original third movement of Symphony No.10 Zur Herbstzeit Op.213 (see above).

Orchester-Vorspiel zu Shakespeares Sturm [Orchestral Prelude to Shakespeares The Tempest] WoO.49 (1879).

Listen to an extract

Published: 2006, Edition Nordstern. Premiere: 4 February 1881 Wiesbaden.

Orchester-Vorspiel zu Shakespeares Macbeth [Orchestral Prelude to Shakespeares Macbeth] WoO.50 (1879).

Listen to an extract

Published: 1891, Schmidt (USA - posthumous). Premiere: 13 January 1882, Wiesbaden.

Orchester-Vorspiel zu Shakespeares Romeo und Julie [Orchestral Prelude to Shakespeares Romeo and Juliet] WoO.51 (1879). Listen to an extract

Published: 1891, Schmidt (USA - posthumous). Premiere: 4 January 1884, Wiesbaden.

Orchester-Vorspiel zu Shakespeares Othello [Orchestral Prelude to Shakespeares Othello] WoO.52 (1879). Listen to an extract

Published: 2018, Edition Nordstern. Unperformed, but recorded.

Große Fuge [Grand Fugue] WoO.56 (1882).

Unpublished. LOST. Left fully sketched, with orchestration indications, at Raff's death.

Works for Wind Band

Marsch [March] WoO.16A by Franz Liszt (1853).

Unpublished. Unperformed. Arrangement for military band, made at Liszt's request, of the original version of his March for piano S.228.

Fest-Ouvertüre (für Blasinstrumente) über vier beliebte Burschenlieder [Festival Overture (for Wind Instruments) on four favourite Student Songs] Op.124 (1865). Listen to the complete work

Published: 2021, Edition Nordstern. Premiere: 15 August 1865, Jena.
